channel.title: ClassFormatError: WrongInnerClasses attribute length in class file
channel.description:
Whenever I edit a .class with ClassEditor, (my server's compiler doesn't work) I always get this error.
I think it may have something to do with the server being confused by the changed length of the line I edited, but I don't know, I'm very inexperienced with Java.
If someone could please explain how to fix this step-by-step, I'd really appreciate it.
Thanks.

item.title: ClassFormatError: WrongInnerClasses attribute length in class file
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

You should only be editing the .JAVA files. .CLASS files are not suppose to be read by humans.
If you have messed up your .CLASS file and are getting errors. Just delete it and re-compile.

Read full topic
item.source: ClassFormatError: WrongInnerClasses attribute length in class file

item.title: ClassFormatError: WrongInnerClasses attribute length in class file
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Step 1: don’t edit the class files.
Step 2: fix your server’s compiler or get an IDE
Step 3: edit the java files.
Step 4: Compile or run it in your ide.

Read full topic
item.source: ClassFormatError: WrongInnerClasses attribute length in class file
